answers.text: each dialect has some similarities with the neighboring one, and differences grow with distance.

qas.question: What caused the dialect continuum to become fractured?

answers.text: migrations from the 16th to 18th centuries resulting from the spread of Ottoman Empire on the Balkans

qas.question: Contrary to the 16th and 18th centuries, what caused migrations in the 20th century?
What did the spread of the Ottoman Empire in the 20th century contribute to?

plausible_answers.text: each dialect has some similarities with the neighboring one, and differences grow with distance

qas.question: What are two characteristics of urbanization?
What did the Balkans create historically?
What did wars cause from the 16th to 18th centuries?
What broke urbanization into many geographical pockets?

context: South Slavic historically formed <b5_0>a dialect continuum<b5_0/>, i.e. <a0_0><b4_0>each dialect has some similarities with the neighboring one, and differences grow with distance<b4_0/>.<a0_0/> However, <a1_0>migrations from the 16th to 18th centuries resulting from the spread of Ottoman Empire on the Balkans<a1_0/> have caused <b6_0><b7_0>large-scale population displacement<b7_0/><b6_0/> that broke the dialect continuum into many geographical pockets. Migrations in the 20th century, primarily caused by <a2_0>urbanization and wars<a2_0/>, also contributed to <b3_0>the reduction of dialectal differences<b3_0/>.
